unit_learning_outcomes.description: Detect intrusion in networks and systems by applying tools and techniques revealing abnormal patterns in datasets.
Explain the basic concepts and the limitations of Artificial Intelligence.
Analyse the trends of applications of Artificial Intelligence in cyber security.
Communicate professionally in written and oral form to a range of audiences.

enrolment_rules.description: (COMP6320 or ITEC653) or admission to MInfoTechCyberSec

assessments.description: A three hour examination in the exam period.

In this assignment, the student will be given a series of datasets and will be asked to develop an analysis of this data and provide a report. The aim of this task is to be able to identify unusual patterns and abnormal activity using data.
In this assessment task, students as a group will be required to research and evaluate a tool leveraging AI for cyber security purposes. The task also involves a presentation of the findings.
Each week, a mark will be awarded based on the level of participation shown by students in the discussion during the lectures.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: COMP8325 - Applications of Artificial Intelligence for Cyber Security
data.description: This unit deals with the applications of Artificial Intelligence in the field of Cyber Security. Topics covered include machine learning-based intrusion detection systems, malware detection, AI as a service, digital forensics, incident response leveraging SIEM data. Special attention will be given to the concept of adversarial machine learning.
